title: Why do some people write 'an' instead of 'and'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Almost every time I’ve ever written “an” instead of “and” when it should have been “and,” it was a typo where i just missed the “D” because I was typing too quickly. That said, if you see someone doing this all the time for every instance where it should have been “and” but they’re using “an” instead, then it’s probably ignorance, poor writing skills, laziness, or a combination of all three.

I ate an APPLE I ate a piece of watermelon I ate a fish meal. I an orange for lunch I went to see a movie/ I had an experience today.. A comes before the consonant. B C D F G H J K L M N P Q R S T U V W X Y Z AN Comes before a vowel. A E I O U
